Reviews.Title: Economical full-featured small camera...
Reviews.Author: Victor H. Agresti "remodeling-guy"

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo37W0NS6YGXIGHcurrentClick) { return cv_mo37W0NS6YGXIGHcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:31 MinsThe sample video was taken with this camera from the Maryland side of the Potomac River at Great Falls National Park overlooking the main channel on January 28, 2010. The river was swollen from melting snow. High winds played havoc with the tiny camera microphone, distorting the sound.Olympus Stylus 7010 12MP Digital Camera with 7x ZoomI've taken thousands of photos with my Nikon DSLR (Digital Single Lens Reflex), but my wife won't touch it because "it's too big and complicated". So, we bought this tiny Olympus for her.Pros:- Camera is capable of taking excellent photos.- Smaller than a pack of cigarettes, the 7010 is easily carried on your belt, in a purse, your pocket, a car's storage bin, etc. In its case on your belt, someone might think it's a cell phone. There are smaller cameras available, but not with the features (such as the 7x zoom) of this model.- Automatic lens guard. When the camera is off, the lens is protected from dust, fingers, or objects touching it. Turn the camera on and within a half second, the lens extends and the lens guard opens. Cameras without this built-in protection are much more likely to collect dust on the lens.- The optical zoom (to 7x) is astounding for such a tiny camera. On the other hand, landscapes or other wide-angle scenes are quite doable with no zoom. (Of course, the built-in image stabilization is mandatory for high-zoom shots.) The telephoto lens moves very quickly at the touch of a button, almost too quickly; but at least you don't have to wait.- Excellent, sharp, 2.7" LCD screen to view scenes, images/movies taken, menus, etc.- On the AUTO setting, the camera selects shutter speed, ISO, white balance, flash/no flash, etc., which is what my wife wanted. All you do is point, and shoot. On the P setting, you can "program" those variables, and other options; then, you can then quickly switch the mode dial between AUTO, P, and built-in scene settings, while walking around.- The "movie" setting is used to capture a moving scene with sound (but it's a far cry from even a rudimentary camcorder). It couldn't be easier. Select "movie", zoom if you want, and press the shutter "release". When done, press the shutter release again. You can't change the zoom once you start shooting a movie.- The battery seems to handle a couple of hundred shots, but that depends on how the camera is used. If it's used a lot on a vacation for example, you should do a recharge daily.- Has many other features too numerous to go into, such as macro & super macro (extreme closeup), panorama stitched shots, connection to a TV for viewing images, many scene settings, controls that light up at night (for a second or two), etc.- There's only a slight delay on startup or when taking a photo.- Construction quality is excellent.Cons:- In spite of the "dual image stabilization" feature, out-of-focus photos are too common. Of course, holding the camera as still as possible (or supported), not "jerking" the shutter release, etc., helps enormously -- not to mention good lighting. Although she took many excellent shots, a fifth of the photos my wife took on a recent vacation were noticeably blurred. In addition, far too many indoor flash photos are also less than ideally focused (or too dark), so multiple attempts may be required. It could be me, but I find it harder to hold a tiny camera steady versus a large DSLR; so perhaps part of the focus issue is user "error".- On the AUTO setting during a sunny day, over-exposure (too bright) of part of a scene frequently occurs if some subjects are in a shaded area and others are in the sunshine. (I'm possibly being too critical here, but my DSLR handles this situation much better.)- Buttons and controls are really tiny, especially if you have large hands.Other:- 12 MP images at normal compression are around 2,600 KB each, so a 2 GB picture card will hold about 750 photos. A 30 second movie consumes about 10 MB.Summary:Put the Olympus on your short list if you want a really small camera with an excellent image-stabilized zoom, for not too much money. It's also a good backup camera when a big DSLR is impractical to carry. In fact, it's so easy to carry around, you might want to take it wherever you go. In spite of the occasional focus issues, I gave it 4 stars because of its extensive features and relatively low price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew D. White "Smilen"
Reviews.Content: Wanted to purchase a compact camera with a larger zoom and more mega pixels then my old 6mp Fuji.  I was hesitant because this is a new model from Olympus and there were no reviews. This camera works great, plenty of features and great pictures.  The panoramic is really nice and the 640 x 480 video option is good quality for a digital camera even though it disables the zoom function.  With the zoom extended (7X) pictures are occasionally not as sharp.  After owning the camera for a week I'm very pleased with it.  The 8 gig micro sd card holds about 1000 pics at 12mp (fine) or 25 minutes of video.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Ember
Reviews.Content: This is a really impressive camera, especially for the price, and I'm surprised it doesn't have more reviews. I was taking a trip and looking for the best combination of small size, maximum MP, long zoom, and picture quality - and this little guy has it all.First off, it's little. Not the smallest or thinnest camera I looked at, but easily the smallest with a 7x zoom. And that zoom is wonderful. It's also much faster than most of the other cameras I tested. The zoom is zippy and the camera itself only takes about one second to start up after you hit the button. The 12MP is great for high-res images. Also, as advertised, this camera's image stabilization makes it very good at taking shots of moving objects. There isn't much shutter lag time. The camera has both macro and "super macro" modes which take amazing extreme close-ups. It has a very wide angle and can connect images to make a panorama.Potential cons: There is no viewfinder. The LCD is crystal clear, though. The buttons on the back are a little inelegant; they seem clunky to me. But they light up, a big plus at night!This is the perfect camera for someone who wants premium features at a relatively low cost. I looked at 10MP, 3x zoom cameras that cost $100 more than this one, and I still can't figure out how that cost is justified. This is a super point-and-shoot for casual and intermediate photographers.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value!!
Reviews.Author: Kalina T.
Reviews.Content: I took my time before writing this review because I wanted to be sure I used the camera enough to form a solid opinion.  My conclusion is that this camera is an amazing value.  I shopped around both online and at various stores and I couldn't find any 12 megapixel camera with this much (7X) zoom for anywhere near the price I ultimately paid for this one.I took it on a very important vacation trip where we went to two concerts, took it to a gourmet luncheon put on by the Culinary Dept. of the local college, etc. etc.  I also tested it against my old Sony 3X (which I still love).  The Olympus produced excellent photos and compared favorably up against the Sony Cybershot.  It's amazingly compact for a 7X zoom and lighter and thinner than the Sony 3X.Perhaps that reviewer who gave it 1 star didn't read the manual?  I can't understand how someone could take over a thousand photos and get 10 decent ones.  I took about 100 and the few that got tossed were my fault, not the camera's.  I'm very happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: varnav
Reviews.Content: I remember those point-and-shoot Olympus digital cameras from mid 2000s - great images with click of a button. That's what I was expecting - and got disappointed. The picture quality is even worse that my old Canon A60 (from year 2003) makes.The biggest problem is - megapixels. Too many. Many megapixels combined with small sensor area in compact cameras result in very much noise at dark. The camera images are too noisy in any indoor environment, even at relatively low 400 ISO and even with flash! In other hand stabilizer is good - indoor images are sharp, but noisy.And will you ever need all those 12 megapixels? I doubt. Will you get noisy images because of them? Sure. But this is marketing.And, the worst thing - you may lower the megapixel setting in the camera - but sensor will still be the same high-resolution high-noise one.The second big big problem is proprietary standards. The cable and connector look like mini-USB, but they are actually some kind of special Olympus-only connector. You may, fortunately, use micro-SD card (not only inferior xD) with this camera - but it is connected unusual way through the special adapter.And compact size has it's drawbacks - it's hard to hold the camera in hand but it's easy to accidentally close flash with your finger. buttons are tiny even for my small hands.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, 7X Compact Just What I wanted
Reviews.Author: R. Rhoades
Reviews.Content: $180 for a compact 12MP 7X optical zoom is just what I was looking for to get better pics of the wildlife here, and family photos. After using the 7010 for two months, the auto point and shoot works quickly, the wide-angle and panoramic modes produce very good pics, and the low-light flash shots are good from 15ft or less.Comparing the 7010 to my older digicams, the resolution does not "seem" to be quite 12MP sharpness, nor does the zoom "seem" to be quite 7X, but for $180 this camera is just what I wanted for a compact, mainly point & shoot. The battery life is excellent. It is fast, quiet, and takes good photos that print out very well.

Reviews.Title: Most bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Syed A. Zaidi
Reviews.Content: For the price, this camera surpassed my expectations.  The different shooting modes made it really easy to get the best shots depending on the what I was trying to take a picture of and the surrounding lighting.  The Auto mode does an excellent job also in determining which mode to shot in.I highly recommend this camera.To get the most out the camera, read the manual.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: M.Taglauer
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for our daughter for Christmas. Worked fine right out of the box but for some reason the camera locked up. The lense was extended but the camera portion wouldn't work. All other functions were OK. Contacted Amazon who shipped a replacement right away (GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE) The second one again worked right out of the box and continues to work flawlessly. Takes Great pictures, long battery life and although AA batteries are convenient, the batteries don't last if you leave them in the camera, and it is a pain to take the batteries out every time you store the camera. This camera has the lithium ion battery that has a very long camera life and quick recharge time. Very satisfied with the camera and the pictures it produces.

Reviews.Title: A New Love Affair
Reviews.Author: EPitt
Reviews.Content: I bought an Olympus digital camera 6 years ago which served me well so when I decided on purchasing a new camera, I knew I wanted another Olympus (the camera on my cell phone has more megapixels than that old little thing). I absolutely love the stylus! For less than $200, you get a really great little camera. The screen is great, there are so many features, and it's really easy to use. You can take some really amazing pictures (and movies too!) with it. If you want a good, reliable camera, definitely go for it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: F. M. Newcomer
Reviews.Content: Great Camera.  The 7X zoom is quite good and picture resolution good for the price. Much better than the  Kodak M380 we returned to Staples.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus-7010
Reviews.Author: Terry J. Mindham "Terry Mindham"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Olympus 7010 to replace my Canon S2 IS with 5 mega pixels and a 12x tele lens (bought in '05 to replace a 3 meg that succumbed to the sand in Iraq). While I loved the Canon's 12x, 5 megs just doesn't get it any more, and the Olympus is so much more compact. I'm an avid mountain hiker, and it's nice to have a 12 mega camera, super thin, that attaches to my belt for quick access. Other 'musts' with the Olympus are that it has image stabization, panoramic ability, and a 7x tele lens. Most point-and-shoots only have a 4x lens and that's not good enough (like getting closeups of sheep in Scotland a couple years ago).  While I am also in the market for a good mid-level SLR digital, like the Nikon D90(had four SLR 35mm's in my previous life), this little gem will long have a place in my travel plans. I currently have my house on the market to sell myself, and the Olympus's 28mm wide angle lens took some all-inclusive shots indoors that I just couldn't achieve with the older Canon.  This uber-wonder by Olympus packs so many excellent features in such a small package that I couldn't resist making it a necessity. To me, there just wasn't any legitimate competition for under $160 (via Amazon) or even $200.  When size matters (small), this camera is the one. I absolutely love this little guy!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: M. Kane
Reviews.Content: This camera has many features for the price.  The lack of a printed instruction book is a bit annoying, but the CD has all the information.  So far, after using it for one week, I am quite impressed with the quality of the photos.

Reviews.Title: What I wanted-Almost
Reviews.Author: C. S. Welch "buckeyechris"
Reviews.Content: This is the the 3rd Olympus digital camera I've owned.  The prior models were 2 and 5 MP, respectively.  I upgraded to the Stylus 7010 in order to get sharper "close ups" at my kids sporting events, etc....  The 7X zoom and 12 MP really helps.  Like my previous Olympus cameras, it does not do well in low light situations (unless you're using a tripod).  I had hoped it would perform better at indoor school functions, etc...  However, it's compact size and relatively light weight make it easy to pack and carry.  SUGGESTION:  get an additional battery; I did.  The LCD screen uses a lot of juice, so another battery is necessary for prolonged use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Wayne Williams "The_Stayne"
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, has many features that are easily understood and easy to use, good optics, and has a fast power on time and is available for the next photo shortly after taking a picture.  One small downside is it uses the Olympus/Fuji specific XD memory cards which are available in sizes UP TO 2GB.  But it does include an adapter to use Micro SDHC cards.  I found a 2GB XD online for $15 and a 8GB (type 6) Micro SDHC for $17.  So either format is cheap and easily available.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME !
Reviews.Author: loves to shoot ""Nat""
Reviews.Content: its great, it takes high quality pictures and does well in various settings. easy to use, yet professional quality.

Reviews.Title: I had to return my original purchase just to get one with the same issue
Reviews.Author: J. Minarik "Blava 72"
Reviews.Content: After just 3 weeks using the camera, the lens got stuck and would not go back to the original position after zoom in, I was unable to turn on the came to take pictures. After Amazon return I got new one and now 3 months the exact same issue, while I was zooming in taking pictures at my daughter's dance recital the camera quit on me stuck with the zoom out. I am very very discouraged I owned other Olympus camera and always had good experience until now.The saga keeps going on!!!! After another repair that I had to pay for the shipping and add another year the same PROBLEM exactly the same happend. When calling Olympus they pretty much say too bad so sad. Send it in and will tell you how much it is going to cost.

Reviews.Title: looks good on paper; mediocre performance
Reviews.Author: Karyda
Reviews.Content: PROS:*7x optical zoom.*Very tiny/portable.*Image stabilisation is awesome--minimal blur, esp. compared to my old camera (clunky old 3 MP kodak).CONS:*Pictures come out extremely grainy, even on low ISO settings.*Seems to be some colour loss.  Even on shots that come out okay, I almost feel it necessary to ramp up the saturation after the fact because everything comes out so dull.Maybe I had too high of expectations for this camera; for the list of features and cheap price, I guess it was unreasonable to expect vibrant, high quality shots.If you plan to reduce the pictures for posting on the web/sharing it's probably sufficient; if you want something to take high resolution/quality pictures for a desktop background or something, don't bother.Personally wouldn't buy again--wish my camera savvy friend had gotten back to me sooner before I ordered this.  He recommended a canon; might try there next, though I never had issues with the olympus' we had at work (tough line).  Maybe this one would perform better in outdoor conditions (only used it inside so far).

Reviews.Title: Good Camera For The Money
Reviews.Author: Bechtolds
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since March (about). Over all I love it. I've dropped it many of times and it still works well. It takes nice pictures, the battery last a long time, its easy to transport, it thin, it has great zoom. Some cons are that its Panoramic sucks from what I've used, you have to convert pictures into black and white after taking them (which can be annoying especial if you are new with the camera), and after a couple months the lens cover (the black thing on the front of the lens that retracts upon power up and detracts after shut up) didn't completely retract. You have to push it with your finger in order to make it do that.Over all a good camera though. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera
Reviews.Author: K. HUANG
Reviews.Content: Amazing little camera.  I love the super-macro mode.  You can took the picture less than 1 inch away.  Put it on Hi-ISO and snap!  That's all you need to do.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price
Reviews.Author: James M. Sale "Carolyn S."
Reviews.Content: I decided I needed a reasonable quality camera that I could stick in my pocket and would be easy to use when I travel.  On a trip to the Caribbean recently I checked with some shops on the islands (where I heard you could get the best deals) and came across this particular camera that had all the features I wanted and liked.  I almost made the purchase but decided to pass and check with Amazon when I got home.Good thing I did.  I saved almost $50 in the actual purchase from Amazon vs. the shops in the Caribbean and I'm very happy with the camera.The camera itself does everything as advertised and I especially like the software that came with it.  Unless you get to the cameras that are priced 2 and 3 times (or more) as much, you are not going to find a better deal.It's a great little camera and at a great price if you get it from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I am returning mine
Reviews.Author: M. Vandemark
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing my first point and shoot camera and thought this camera was exactly what I was looking for.  I liked that it had the most zoom and megapixels in it's class, but I am disappointed with my pictures.  They are not sharp and colorful, therefore, I am returning mine.  I loved the size, it was great to stick in my purse and go.  The screen was awesome and has great features (although the buttons are super tiny), but in the end, I need a camera that takes great pictures and this just didn't produce the pictures I wanted.  I used the auto setting mostly, but did play around with the camera and use the night setting, the landscape setting and the portrait setting.  I took pictures indoor and outdoor, day and night (we were on vactaion).  No matter what I used, the pictures looked a bit blah and grainy.  It takes the same xD card that my old camera took, so I printed off the entire card to compare pictures taken with my old camera to this one, and there was a HUGE difference.  While I love the size, I may have to give up size for quality pictures and go back to my bigger camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Camera Woman
Reviews.Content: This is the second Olympus Sytlus camera I have owned.  I had my first one for 5 years and loved it so after I broke it (dropped it 1 to many times) I immediately new I wanted another Olympus camera.  The size is wonderful - it fits in my pocket; it is easy to use and takes wonderful pictures.  I can't wait to try the panoramic feature - that's new to me.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 7010 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Terry J. Mindham "Terry Mindham"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Canon that I purchased in 2005 --- the Power Shot S2 IS, with 12x zoom --- a great camera, but only 5 megs. The Canon was ultra dependable, and never gave me a problem that necessitated repair. But other than the 5 megs, I needed something more compact as a 'pocket' camera, and intend to buy the Nikon D90 SLR as my primary camera (having owned 4 diff 35mm SLR's in the old days). This 7010 has an amazing number of features for such a small package. The 7x zoom is what really impressed me (equiv to 28mm-196mm in the old 35mm format)because most compact digitals in this price range only offer a 3x or 4x, plus 12mp, image stabilization, and the ability to take panoramic pictures. I've found that it also takes great shots in low light. I travel often, and regularly hike and bicycle, which makes the compact package the perfect size. I also love the 28mm wide angle, which is wider than my old Canon S2 IS. I read the reviews on this unit and found that there really isn't anything out there that compares with the quality and features for the low price. I am very pleased with this Olympus as my 'backup' camera, and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade
Reviews.Author: Katy L. Sheeler "katy1226"
Reviews.Content: Great replacement for an older model of the same camera. Camera still subseptable to damage if dropped. That's what happened to my previous one.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 7010 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeri G. Jones "mermaid"
Reviews.Content: This camera is the hardest to use.  The master disc to download is a real pain, do not download the newer version that comes up when you are downloading the original.  I had to reload it and remove it several times, my PC could not accept the camera when I plugged it in.  This camera also does NOT come with a memory card either so you have to purchase it, the website does not tell you this.  I am extremely frustrated with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: happy customer
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: there is not one thing i dont like about the camera. the size is small so i cna put it in my pocket, got agreat zoom and it works great ande it was re-furbished without an s and thh price was exceptional.John

Reviews.Title: Sleek Design - Amazing Features - Great Price
Reviews.Author: Amy M Wise
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an upgrade for a prior model. This is my second Olympus camera and I absolutely love it! For anyone who loves taking pictures this an awesome camera at a great price. My niece has a by far more expensive "cool pix" and the picture quality of my Olympus 7010 hands down blows it away! I researched many cameras before deciding on this one and narrowed it down to this and the 7030...after reading several mixed reviews on the 7030, I decided to go with this one and am so glad I did. I am truly impressed with the ease of use of this camera, its features, and the included program. I love that it has the panoramic and wide angle options and best of all 7X zoom! It's perfect size and sleek design take this camera over the top! I've only had this camera for about of week now so I can't say much for the durability, but if its anything like my prior Olympus (stylus 710) I am sure to be impressed (it still works great even with a crack in the side from being dropped from a balcony about 12ft)!! Great Bargain too...big bang for your $$

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 7010 12mp
Reviews.Author: Pleased with my Purchase "Karen"
Reviews.Content: I buoght this for my youngest son for his Christmas gift.  He loves how easy it is to take the perfect pictures.  It really takes very clear, bright pictures, even of fireworks for New Years and sky lines of the city on a foggy night.  Cant ask for much more in a small digital camera.  I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Timothy Couto
Reviews.Content: The camera is takes great pictures.  Not so hot video quality; but overall very easy to use and satisfied

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!!!!
Reviews.Author: ntmomof3
Reviews.Content: i don't know if i've ever left a review for a product but i knew i had to leave one for this camera!  i just bought it yesterday.  i used it on a field trip today to the zoo with my son's preschool class.  the pictures the camera took were amazing!  the color was crisp, the zoom is awesome, the shutter speed is really fast!  i am about 90-95% happy with this camera.  so far, since i've only had it a day, the only con i can find at this point is that the battery life is minimal.  i had the camera on and taking pictures with it for about an hour and a half to two hours when the battery died.  now, i didn't have the camera off and turn it on and turn it off and turn it back on, etc.  maybe i should have?  maybe this would have saved battery life?  i would think it would use up more, but i don't know much about that.  so, needless to say, i'll be buying at least 2 back up batteries to have in the event i loose battery life again during an outing.  oh!  and there's a "back light" so this is really easy to navigate in the dark.  overall, despite the minimal battery life, i still give this camera 5 stars!  i am truly amazed at the picture quality compared to cameras i've used in the past.  who knows...maybe i've had crappy cameras up until now and didn't know it!  ;)  SUPER happy with this olympus stylus 7010!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Folks "stephylee"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera!! It takes great shots of things in motion and the zoom is amazing for such a small camera.  I'm not very good with electronics but this camera has been pretty easy to use.  I wish it would have came with an owners manual instead of an owners CD but that's my only complaint.  I had to read up on a few of the settings to make sure I was using the best options for pictures.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: With this price - I can't complain!
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Lim
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace my old dead Olympus Stylus 760 and was surprised to find a better camera (more Megapixels, better screen, some gimmicky features) for a much cheaper price.  Better yet, my memory card and batteries for the 760 were compatible with the 7010.  The materials used to construct the camera seem cheaper than my old 760, but I was looking for a cheap point and shoot and so far it's all that I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Olympus makes an enthusiast out of an amateur
Reviews.Author: Subhash Pasupuleti "Kiwiana"
Reviews.Content: A simple easy to use point and shoot Digital camera. Olympus Stylus 7010 has 7x zoom. Picture  clarity is upto expectations for a non DSLR camera. it is a good entry level camera available in the price range

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: wizardwoof
Reviews.Content: GREAT zoom. Easy to use. Lots of automatic features. It lasted for years til I finally dropped it right on its screen and it shattered. Darn.

Reviews.Title: It was poor
Reviews.Author: Michael Cooper
Reviews.Content: It quit working after a year and a half. Bought new battery, cord for it. Worked a little while longer . I buy Nikon now

Reviews.Title: Quit working
Reviews.Author: Bruce Siefers
Reviews.Content: I liked it for about two years then it quit working.  Was going to replace the circuit board but couldn't get the screws out, so I bought a newer and better Olympus SZ-20.

Reviews.Title: Okay while it lasted
Reviews.Author: B. R. Tew
Reviews.Content: This camera lasted only 14 months. I was uploading pictures to my computer with the cable when it stopped working - the lens stuck and it would not come on. Previously I had used a usb stick that read the Olympus storage card. I don't know if using the cable caused it to stop working, but I would recommend using the usb reader to be safe. The body of the camera was still in perfect condition so I hated to throw it in the trash. But Olympus wanted $75 to repair it (if repairable) which I thought was too high. It took okay pictures while it was working, but I would not buy another one like this. I find the regular SD cards much easier to use, and my computer and laptop have a slot for them.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Guerry Davis
Reviews.Content: It was purchased as a replacement for the same camera that I lost. So glad to have it since I was familiar with how to use it. Makes great pictures and easy to carry. Glad I could replace it even if I couldn't recover the pictures I had lost. I do recommend this to others on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: Grey Replacement
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I've already owned one of these cameras, the one I ordered a few days ago was the replacement. The first one I had lasted through A LOT years of abuse yet it still took great pictures before it bit the dust. For a point and shoot, it's a very good camera. It has a decent amount of customization, can auto-focus pretty well, has good image quality, and is easy to use. So, if you can't afford an expensive camera, I would go with this one. =)

Reviews.Title: Olympus stylus 7010
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Young
Reviews.Content: It does take good  pictures, but I often find it difficult to understand the instructions.  It is a very good size.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus Camera
Reviews.Author: TIMA FORD
Reviews.Content: Got this for a friends wife for him for her Christmas present.  She has seen pictures mine takes and liked it.  I was lucky to fine one for him.  I am very impressed with this camera.  I have had mine for about 4 years and I have taken sooooo many pictures and they come out great!  I would recomend this camera to anyone.  I paid a lot more but I got mine when it first came out.  I checked the reviews on the new version/replacement for this camera, and I was not impressed with the new version. But this camera ROCKS!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera if you customize the settings
Reviews.Author: JY
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few years ago, from a sale at an office supply store (Staples? Office Depot? Not sure.). The 7x optical zoom is almost impossible to find at this price point, so I couldn't pass this one up.Be extremely careful with the battery- the first time, I inserted it the wrong way and almost pulled off part of it trying to get it back out. Despite this, it still works (when inserted correctly), but the battery edge is a little loose. Totally not the camera or battery's fault, 100% mine.I was...very disappointed with the camera when I first used it. The pictures looked grainy and dark, even with excellent lighting (on the Auto setting). I never transferred the pictures to my laptop, but now I realize it is possibly the LCD screen's fault. However, after playing around with the settings on the "P" mode and customizing them to "Hi2" (High-speed 2), 3m->fine, ISO Auto, and no flash (this camera has the worst flash ever), I soon had an excellent camera in my hands. Sure, the high speed mode takes multiple pictures, but it's a nuisance I'll put up with when I have superb pictures.This camera comes with a cable to connect it to a computer, but if all you want to do is import pictures, I highly recommend getting a card adapter/reader. If you use the cable, it drains the camera's battery. This camera died on me while I had connected it to the computer.Which brings me to another point- battery life. The battery life isn't the best. It won't last a whole day of taking pictures frequently (like if you're sight-seeing or on vacation or something), so I recommend buying an extra battery.I use the XD-microSD card adapter that came with this camera. I rarely see XD cards in stores anymore, so I stick with the microSD cards. A lot of microSDs conveniently come with SD card adapters, and my laptop comes with a built-in SD card reader (as do many laptops, nowadays) so that works out fabulously.The macro and super-macro modes are great, and work very well. I can take a very clear picture of the fabric of my jeans when the camera lens is about 5 mm above it.I don't really use the SCN mode often, since the customized "P" mode is fantastic. However, the Sunset mode is really nice for taking pictures of lights or sunsets, since it won't give you that annoying line of light across the picture. The beauty mode is a nice touch, but I don't use it often and honestly, I don't see much of a difference between the original picture and the edited one.The camcorder sucks. It won't let you zoom in and out while recording, and the little microphone records fuzzy sounds. But I didn't buy it for the camcorder (I have a real one for that), so I'm okay with that. It'll do in a pinch.OVERALL, highly recommended. Well worth the money, and it's still going strong after three years.

Reviews.Title: Decent but lacking
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I got this during a sale as a deal for I think under $100. It's a pretty good point and shoot, but there were a few things that bothered me:The video isn't in HD.Zoomed in pictures tend to get blurryHas less resolution (12MP) than certain Nikon and Canon point and shootsThere's zoom buttons rather than a turning switch to zoom in/outcan't delete multiple photos at a time in cameraOn the other hand, there were some very good thingsThe iso is changeableThere is a burst shoot modeThe panorama function is excellent and easy and fun to useit looks sleek and very stylishThe LCD screen is clearMenus are logically arrangedIf I could go back though, I definitely would have bought a point and shoot that had HD video and more MP. If lacking that doesn't bother you, I'd say this is one fine camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Nin
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer or anything close to it. I just wanted a point and shoot camera, that would be compact, so that I could easily carry it around wherever I go, and one that took some quality pictures. Fortunately this camera is and does, what it's supposed to be and do. The only problem with it, is that it holds very small number of pictures, like 10 pictures with it's internal memory. That's why I ordered a Micro SD card, so I am waiting for that to arrive, and I am sure I will love my compact camera even more. The battery life seemed decent, though if you're going hiking or sightseeing and won't be able to charge you battery I recommend getting an extra battery. I would recommend this product to anyone who wants a not too expensive camera that does a great job in taking amazing photos, both night and day, indoors and outdoors. Shipping was very fast, it took less time than I expected!

Reviews.Title: vendor review- for purchase of Olympus camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stellar service from vendor.  Thought I had a problem, absolutely did not.  Tech supply center was excellent and I would definitely buy from them again. The camera on the other hand came with a defect. Never got it to work.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus-7010
Reviews.Author: Good&Bad
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon P60 which I have used a LOT..That camera was a workhorse and was really easy to hold onto securely, unlike this Olympus, which, to me has a very slippery surface. having said that, my Nikon just stopped working, right before New Years Eve of course! So I started using the Olympus which is my wife's camera and to my surprise I liked it. I haven't tried everything on it but I was amazed that if has a Super Macro setting, which if you like doing closeups is great. All in all, the camera has been great to use.  The rechargeable battery is a pain, the usb connector is non-standard and it is slippery as an eel to hang onto, but overall still a really handy camera to have so its a 3.5 to 4 star camera in my opinion. I plan on purchasing an Olympus to replace the Nikon, probably either the newer 16mp with 24X Zoom or the 14mp with 18x Zoom....Haven't decided but for the small amount of money it seems like Olympus has come up with some good cameras.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned......
Reviews.Author: What I think.... "I shop Amazon daily"
Reviews.Content: Best camera I've ever owned......Olympus Stylus 7010 12MP Digital Camera with 7x Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Pink)....Simple yet great!~

Reviews.Title: Great Indoor Point-N-Shoot
Reviews.Author: KBPayton
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid Cannon fan having one of the first ELPH's made, however, when I purchased my last one for some $300 all I got were blurry, and more blurry pictures. Disappointment was the least of my emotions as my 2 year old wasn't going backwards in time. So I switched to a Nikon Coolpix because my mom had one and that seemed to take some crystal clear beautiful shots. It was great - but NOT indoors....rrrrr...still not happy. Paid for a Panasonic Luminex - it was ok - nothing I wanted to jump up and down about, sold it. So I found this camera - and it's pink - adorable. Not to mention that it has some really cool image effects, like fish-eye etc...I can't figure out how to use them but I'm sure someone else will who doesn't have a toddler attached to their hip and touching everything. This camera takes really great indoor shots, really great. Outside is good - not as good as my coolpix, so I kept both. I don't really like having multiple devices, it's like having an apple computer, with an ipod, blackberry, iphone and ipad...really??? It's like, ok, we're ready to go...(and in the car) O, who has the baby? I mean really, I don't have enough brain synapses happening to remember all that.With that said, I've kept my coolpix for outside shots, or in VERY lit places (like for work at a department store...), and this olympus is my indoor camera.I guess if you want just one camera - get a Cannon ELPH with fewer pixels than 7.0 because I didn't find one model with higher than 7 megapixels to take good shots.So why 4 stars? When I read the reviews there were many inferences made regarding the battery charge/power and megapixels. I hoped it was a fluke. IT wasn't. I got this camera, I LOVE it, and again, it took beautiful shots. But...in the box for a month and a half because I was moving...blah blah blah and tried turning it on for a great  Halloween bash...it was dead, dead, dead. Tried recharging - battery won't hold the charge and camera won't stay on. Not sure what to do about this and super annoyed. Hope someone has better luck.

Reviews.Title: La camara que buscaba con "super macro" y "beauty"
Reviews.Author: Mia
Reviews.Content: Necesitaba una camara de fotos que tuviese el zoom perfecto para tomar foto de las joyas que hago, detalles muy pequeños que solo con el super macro pudiesen salir nitidos...probe muchas camaras incluida la Canon Power Shot y encontre mi "super macro" en esta camara Olympus Stylus, Olympus incorpora el "super macro" en varios de sus modelos y es una super ventaja para quien como yo necesita tomar fotos de detalles pequeños. Ademas de que el color rosa me encanta, es femenina, moderna, la bateria carga rapido y un DETALLASO : tiene una opcion que se llama "beauty" que sirve para tomar fotos de rostros y resalta el brillo de los ojos y los agranda... Que mas se le puede pedir a una camara de fotos, es sensacional.

Reviews.Title: All it needs is a lens cap
Reviews.Author: jain
Reviews.Content: The Olympus Stylus 7010 is a neat little camera that does more than expected for the price. It's much thinner and lighter than my previous digital camera, which is what I was looking for in a take-it-everywhere camera. The only drawback is the very sensitive lens cover, which jammed partly open the first day I used it, when I stuck the camera in my pocket. I gently tugged it shut, and it functioned fine after that. Now I keep it in a soft cover when in my pocket or purse, so it has lost some points for not being quite so thin and easy to grab on the go. I love the automatic setting; great for the casual user who wants to capture a scene as it happens without needing to reset from panorama to macro or flash to natural light. When you wish to set up a shot the different scene settings are easy to find.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: M. Subramanian "Mani"
Reviews.Content: A very nice Camera, I picked Olympus, as I am a big fan of Olympus cameras in the past (the film models). The digital models are not comparable to their earlier film based point and shoot models, but this one delivers a good image 85% of the times.It would have been good, if there was a printed manual along with the package, and the instructions on the CD provided is not easily searchable. Since they have decided to give the manual in CD, it would be good if there were some video instructions on the advanced features.The battery life is somewhat shorter than my other digital cameras that I had in past, but the picture quality and night shots are great on this one.A good starter/medium level model.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 7010
Reviews.Author: Dottie N. "BookLuver"
Reviews.Content: Needed a replacement camera and have been happy with Olympus in the past.  This is very easy to use and the pictures are very good!

Reviews.Title: A good friend in daily life
Reviews.Author: Yuemeng Wang "starmoon"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer, and I bought this camera only for recording my everyday story, scene and something interesting. I really love this dapper and powerful camera, amazingly thin with 7X optical zoom, and also an appealing price. I also love the pictures it takes, beautiful light and nice focus. You can also try a various of features and modes it contains and you'll always find a proper combination for what you'd like to record. Besides, I like the big LCD very much as you can see clearly even when the sunlight is strong.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Mill Harris
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Olympus 7010 for my son as a Christmas gift.He loves the camera and its ease of operations.He also loves the zoom feature.Great seller with a fast delivery.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed in the picture quality
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I am a great fan of olympus and did a lot of research online before I decided to purchase this camera.  Everything on this camera is as described expect for the picture quality.  I really made the effort to give this camera a chance and used it on numerous occassions.  Each time the PICTURE QUALITY CAME UP VERY POOR.  We took several trips and used this camera and were disappointed with it's results.  I really would not recommend you buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Only Lasted Two Days
Reviews.Author: D. Fujitani "fujitanis"
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived on Friday afternoon. I took a few pictures out of the patio French doors to see that it was working. I was pleased with the picture quality. I put the battery on overnight charge. I used the 7010 the next day around the house. On Sunday I checked the camera but it would not start up. I was able to see a full battery icon on the camera's LCD so I knew that the battery was full. The camera was never dropped or treated roughly. It went back for a refund. I have to rate the Olympus 7010 as junk.

Reviews.Title: less than totally satisfied.
Reviews.Author: RGrabber
Reviews.Content: After three weeks the lens got stuck in the open position.  It is on its way back to me from Olympus.At first they blamed me for possibly turning it on while in my pocket (which I did not).  I said "so what if it turned on in my pocket that could easily happen by accident."  Well it turns out that any obstruction to the lens as it is being turned on (even you finger just touching and an being removed as soon as you feel it)can cause it to be "knocked off the track".At first they wanted me to pay the freight back to them for a 3 week old camera that needed warrenty work.I got a supervisor, and she made a concession to pay the frieght.  Well, it turns out they have an agreement with the UPS Store and a have an account.  The UPS Store even packages it. So this is a common occurance, UPS even has a preprinted form they fill out.So if you have a warrenty problem make sure you get a supervisor.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST CAMERA I EVER HAVE
Reviews.Author: Jia Xing Yang "YANG"
Reviews.Content: it is a really nice camera, the pic quality is very nice, the shutter speed is fast. Recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Gotta love Olympus!!
Reviews.Author: Angela L. Boggs "Angie B"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Olympus and I love them!  I still use my oldest Olympus as a back up.  My last one was dropped from 8 ft with the lens out and broke(my fault for not being careful).  I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: Stopped working 1 year & 2 weeks after purchase
Reviews.Author: Carrie S.
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed using this camera for the past year. Extremely disappointed when I went to use it today and the lens comes in & out and then the camera shuts off.  (And I hadn't dropped it or anything) Have gone through lists of troubleshooting with no success. Seems like product should be useable for more than 1 year & 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Pickypicky
Reviews.Content: After our Canon Powershot recently stopped working, we decided to choose an alternative brand for our next digital camera.  We were happy to find this model that is so loaded with features for a very reasonable price.  I find the camera relatively intuitive to use as well as portable.  I also like the large, brightly lit display.  Unfortunately, a high percentage of photos - even those taken in bright light - seem to be slightly out of focus.  This is especially true when I am taking photos of my kids, who are of course always in motion.  I have found that I need to take many many photos to ensure that a few will be in focus.  For this reason the picture quality is a disappointment.  Please see the two photos of my son that I have posted above. The one that is blurred is typical of the images that come out of this camera.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Edyta J. Pawlowska "edyta pawlowska"
Reviews.Content: We love it. Great buy for us. Pictures and futures are great.I would recommended to anybody.

Reviews.Title: Missing parts
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: My camera arrived without a chip in the memory cube and with no battery.It cost me $10 for the chip and $22 for the battery.The description said the camera was complete.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: A. Blazier
Reviews.Content: Had camera from Dec 25, 2009 to present.Pros: Good pic quality and easy to use. Great zoom and stabilization. Very small for what it does.Cons: Battery life is short (do to size of camera). Buy more batteries. Some very odd features (that you dont have to use). You will understand when you get the camera.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jia Xing Yang "YANG"
Reviews.Content: the best camera i ever have, nice pic quality and fast shutter speed. Easy to use

Reviews.Title: good camera with a poor memory
Reviews.Author: Paul G. McCravy
Reviews.Content: The fact that you must spend extra money for a memory card detracts from an otherwise good camera. The card that came with the Olympus holds only 10 pictures and before you take another they must be deleted or down loaded. I suspect that's one reason it's priced so reasonably.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Gnomeo
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera I've ever had! I bought it on the go, without doing any research. I just urgently needed a camera for my trip to the US. Now I'm looking at the 1700 photos I've taken and there are no more than 10 which I can call "decent"! I can't believe how terrible the photos are - flat, colorless and over/under exposed.I'm now saving for Panasonic Lumix TZ6 which has fantastic reviews, but I'm sure any camera would be better than this rubbish.
